title: Prasad Bhoite
text:
Hi  , I‚Äôm Prasad! 
I am a Senior Data Scientist Manager with 10+ years of experience building AI and machine learning solutions in healthcare and public health. I lead a data team at the Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine, Florida International University, overseeing ML model development, predictive analytics, and AI-driven research projects funded by the university, the state of Florida, and external institutions.
My background combines clinical knowledge, statistical expertise, and computational skills, allowing me to design end-to-end AI/ML pipelines, from data engineering and feature engineering to model deployment and visualization. I am experienced in Python, R, SQL, MS-Azure, PowerBI, ArcGIS, and modern ML frameworks, including hands-on work with Generative AI, LLMs, and predictive modeling.
I am passionate about leveraging AI to solve complex problems and delivering high-impact, scalable solutions that bridge research and real-world applications.
Thank you for visiting!

title: Prasad Bhoite
section: 5: Predicting COVID-19 Vaccine Hesitancy Among US Adults Using Classification Algorithms
text:
5: Predicting COVID-19 Vaccine Hesitancy Among US Adults Using Classification Algorithms


The primary focus of this project revolves around predicting COVID-19 vaccine hesitancy among adults in the United States. To achieve this objective, I employ classification machine learning algorithms and analyze data sourced from the Household Pulse Survey data. Through rigorous examination and interpretation of the data, I aim to gain valuable insights into the factors influencing vaccine hesitancy, ultimately contributing to a better understanding of vaccination patterns and behaviors among the US population‚Ä¶..Continue reading

title: Prasad Bhoite
section: 3: Predicting COVID-19 Vaccine Hesitancy Among US Adults Using Classification Algorithms
text:
3: Predicting COVID-19 Vaccine Hesitancy Among US Adults Using Classification Algorithms


The primary focus of this project revolves around predicting COVID-19 vaccine hesitancy among adults in the United States. To achieve this objective, I employ classification machine learning algorithms and analyze data sourced from the Household Pulse Survey data. Through rigorous examination and interpretation of the data, I aim to gain valuable insights into the factors influencing vaccine hesitancy, ultimately contributing to a better understanding of vaccination patterns and behaviors among the US population‚Ä¶..Continue reading

title: Prasad Bhoite
section: 9: Effortless Access to Household Pulse Survey Datasets with hpsr: An R Data Package.
text:
9: Effortless Access to Household Pulse Survey Datasets with hpsr: An R Data Package.


This project focuses on the development of an R data package- ‚Äòhpsr‚Äô, employing tools such as usethis, Rtools, and R Studio.
The methodology involves downloading CSV files from the Census website, optimizing storage efficiency through Parquet conversion and easy storage on Github, further transforming these files into .rda datasets. The culminating step involves sharing the comprehensive package on GitHub as an open-source contribution to the field of data science‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Continue reading

title: Prasad Bhoite
text:
4: Scientific Research Assistant










This interactive Generative AI application leverages OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4 to assist with scientific paper workflows. It enables researchers and academics to:

üìÑ Upload a PDF and extract structured text
üìö Automatically summarize key findings, objectives, and limitations
üßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è Generate peer reviews in customizable tone (neutral, critical, or supportive)
üîó Analyze citations for recency, diversity, and relevance

The app was built using Python, Streamlit, and OpenAI‚Äôs API, and is packaged with secure .env key handling. It serves as a productivity tool for literature evaluation and publication support.
Continue reading, explore the app and Github Repo. Thank you!

title: Prasad Bhoite
text:
2: Multilingual Virtual Research Assistant (MVRA)










The MVRA application is a powerful multimodal AI assistant built with Meta‚Äôs LLaMA 4 and integrates advanced vision-language capabilities for research and education. Key features include:

üß† Ask general questions and receive contextual answers
üì∞ Summarize long academic texts instantly
üñºÔ∏è Analyze and compare up to 9 images via URLs or file uploads
üåê Translate messages between multiple languages interactively
üóÇÔ∏è Perform image grounding with bounding boxes on uploaded files

Built using Python, Streamlit, LLaMA API, and modular utilities, MVRA demonstrates how LLMs can bridge language, vision, and text for multilingual, multimodal workflows.
Continue reading, explore the app and Github Repo. Thank you!

title: Multilingual Virtual Research Assistant (MVRA)
text:
Tip



MVRA is a Streamlit-based GenAI assistant that empowers researchers with natural language understanding, multilingual translation, image analysis, and synthetic data generation ‚Äî powered entirely by Meta‚Äôs LLaMA 4.

title: Multilingual Virtual Research Assistant (MVRA)
text:
üöÄ Features

üìù Ask a Question: Natural language QA using LLaMA-4 Instruct models such as Llama 4 Scout and Llama 4 Maverick.
üì∞ Summarize Text: Generate concise, research-oriented summaries.
üñºÔ∏è Image Analysis (URL & Upload): Ask questions about images or compare multiple visuals.
üåê Multilingual Translator: Bi-directional translation between English, French, Spanish, Hindi, and Chinese.
üß© Image Grounding: Detect and visualize tools/items in images using bounding boxes.

title: Multilingual Virtual Research Assistant (MVRA)
text:
üß± Tech Stack

Frontend: Streamlit
LLMs: Meta LLaMA 4 (Scout/Instruct via llama-api)
Multilingual API: llama4 w/ compatibility base URL
Vision: Base64 encoding + VQA using multimodal LLaMA
Image Grounding: Regex + pydantic + matplotlib overlays
Deployment: Streamlit Cloud

title: Multilingual Virtual Research Assistant (MVRA)
text:
üß™ Screenshots


‚ö†Ô∏è If you‚Äôre running locally, make sure to configure your .env file and requirements.txt.

text:
Tip



Multi-Agent Job Application Assistant Crew is a modular GenAI application that helps users streamline the job application process using task-specialized CrewAI agents, dynamic forms, and advanced retrieval techniques.

title: Multi-Agent Job Application Assistant Crew
text:
üöÄ Features

ü§ñ Multi-Agent Architecture: Each agent performs a dedicated task (e.g., resume enhancement, cover letter generation, job matching).
üßæ Job Form Parsing: Upload job descriptions or links and auto-parse key requirements.
üìÑ Dynamic Resume Customization: Tailor your resume and experience section based on the job description.
‚úâÔ∏è Cover Letter Generation: Generate personalized, professional cover letters using AI agents.
üß† Memory & Reasoning: Long-term memory using vector store for improved reasoning across tasks.

text:

Framework: Streamlit + CrewAI
LLMs: OpenAI GPT-4o
Retrieval: ChromaDB
Agents: Role-based CrewAI agents (e.g., Researcher, ResumeWriter, Reviewer)
Deployment: Streamlit Cloud

title: Prasad Bhoite
text:
3: Multi-Agent Job Application Assistant Crew










This Multi-Agent Job Application Assistant Crew is a modular, agentic job-seeking assistant built using the CrewAI framework. It uses multiple AI agents to collaboratively generate tailored resumes and interview materials based on a user-uploaded resume (Markdown or PDF).
üíº Upload your resume (Markdown or PDF)
üß† Agents analyze your experience and target job
‚úçÔ∏è Generate a customized resume
üé§ Get personalized interview prep questions
üìÑ Download all results with one click
Built using Python, Streamlit, ChromaDB, and CrewAI agents, this project showcases how agentic workflows can automate and enhance the job application process.
Continue reading, explore the app and Github Repo. Thank you!

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
An AI-powered Grant Writing Assistant designed to help users query and synthesize information from a custom knowledge base about the NeighborhoodHELP (NHELP) program. This application leverages a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture to provide accurate, context-aware answers.
This project is a full-stack AI application demonstrating modern MLOps practices, including a containerized, monolithic architecture and a complete CI/CD and evaluation pipeline.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
üöÄ Features

üí¨ Conversational AI: Remembers chat history to handle follow-up questions.
üìö Dynamic Knowledge Base: Ingests information from PDFs and live websites.
üîé Source Transparency: Displays references for every answer.
‚ö° Streaming Responses: Token-by-token output for responsiveness.
üõ†Ô∏è Developer Dashboard: Manage prompts and knowledge base via a Streamlit admin app.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
üß¨ Tech Stack

Framework: Streamlit

LLM Orchestration: LangChain

LLMs: OpenAI GPT Models

Vector Store: Pinecone

Observability: LangSmith

Evaluation: Ragas

Deployment: Docker + Railway

CI/CD: GitHub Actions

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
Features

Conversational AI: Remembers chat history to answer follow-up questions accurately.
Dynamic Knowledge Base: Ingests information from both PDF documents and live websites.
Source Transparency: Displays the source documents used to generate each answer, improving user trust.
Streaming Responses: Streams answers token-by-token for a responsive user experience.
Developer Dashboard: A separate Streamlit app for managing the knowledge base and tuning system prompts.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
üß± MLOps & Professional Practices

üîÑ CI/CD: Automated linting with Ruff using GitHub Actions.

üìä Evaluation: Built-in pipeline with Ragas to measure faithfulness, relevancy, and answer quality.

üëÅÔ∏è Observability: End-to-end tracing with LangSmith.

üì¶ Containerization: Fully reproducible deployments using Docker.

üìù Prompt Management: Externalized into version-controlled prompts.yml.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text: Tech Stack

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
üèóÔ∏è System Architecture
This project uses a monolithic architecture where a single Streamlit application handles both the user interface and the RAG logic.
Data ingestion is managed by an offline script (ingest.py).

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
‚ö° Getting Started

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Running the Application

Access in Browser Open: https://grantwritingassistantnhelp-production-c6ef.up.railway.app/

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
MLOps & Professional Practices

CI/CD: An automated CI pipeline using GitHub Actions to lint code with Ruff on every push.
Observability: Integrated with LangSmith for full end-to-end tracing and debugging of the RAG chain.
Evaluation: A repeatable evaluation pipeline using Ragas to quantitatively measure the quality of the RAG system (faithfulness, relevancy, etc.).
Containerization: Fully containerized with Docker for reproducible deployments.
Prompt Management: System prompts are externalized into a version-controlled prompts.yml file.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
System Architecture
This project uses a monolithic architecture where a single Streamlit application handles both the user interface and the RAG logic. Data ingestion is handled by a separate, offline script.

title: Grant Writing Assistant
text:
Getting Started

Prerequisites

Python 3.12+
Docker Desktop (optional, for containerized deployment)
API keys for OpenAI, Pinecone, and LangSmith



Local Installation & Setup

Clone the repository: sh     git clone [https://github.com/your-username/your-repo-name.git](https://github.com/your-username/your-repo-name.git)     cd your-repo-name
Create a .env file: In the root directory, create a .env file for your API keys. This is used by the ingest.py and evaluate.py scripts. OPENAI_API_KEY="sk-..."     PINECONE_API_KEY="..."     LANGCHAIN_API_KEY="..."
Install dependencies: This project uses uv for package management.
# Install uv if you don't have it
pip install uv

# Create a virtual environment and install packages
uv venv
uv sync --all-extras
source .venv/bin/activate



Running the Application

Build the Knowledge Base: Run the ingestion script once to process your documents and populate your Pinecone index. sh     python ingest.py
Run the Streamlit App: sh     streamlit run app.py
Access the App: Open your web browser and go to http://localhost:8501.

title: Prasad Bhoite
text:
2: Grant Writing Assistant (RAG)










The Grant Writing Assistant is an AI-powered RAG application built to support the NeighborhoodHELP (NHELP) program. It enables users to query, synthesize, and cite information from a custom knowledge base, making grant writing and program documentation more efficient and accurate. Key features include:

üí¨ Conversational AI with chat memory

üìö Dynamic ingestion from PDFs and live websites

üîé Transparent citations from source documents

‚ö° Streaming token-by-token responses

üõ†Ô∏è Developer dashboard for prompt tuning and knowledge base management

Built with Streamlit, LangChain, OpenAI GPT, Pinecone, Docker, and GitHub Actions, this project demonstrates modern MLOps practices including CI/CD, observability, and evaluation with Ragas.
Continue reading, explore the app.

title: Prasad Bhoite
section: 9: Effortless Access to Household Pulse Survey Datasets with hpsr: An R Data Package
text:
9: Effortless Access to Household Pulse Survey Datasets with hpsr: An R Data Package


This project focuses on the development of an R data package- ‚Äòhpsr‚Äô, employing tools such as usethis, Rtools, and R Studio.
The methodology involves downloading CSV files from the Census website, optimizing storage efficiency through Parquet conversion and easy storage on Github, further transforming these files into .rda datasets. The culminating step involves sharing the comprehensive package on GitHub as an open-source contribution to the field of data science‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Continue reading
